page.title: 19Daily Life for a Commuter.
page.content: The alarm rings at seven. The commuter hurriedly washes and dresses. Breakfast consists of toast and coffee. The twenty minute drive to Milton Keynes station is through peaceful green fields. But in winter darkness and ice make the journey longer and more dangerous. The station platform is crowded. The forty minute train journey separates the calm of the countryside from the noise and bustle of London. People are everywhere. The office day begins after a reviving cup of coffee. Correspondence needs answering. A regular meeting with editors, designer and the sales manager plans next year's new books. Lunch is coffee and a sandwich. The afternoon is spent at a bookseller's offices selling books for Christmas. 5pm Crowded bus and train.Drive home.Meal at 7. TV. Bed at 10.30. End of another day's commuting.
